mckay.utilities.sound.sampled

Class AudioMethodsRecording.RecordToFileThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • mckay.utilities.sound.sampled.AudioMethodsRecording.RecordToFileThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Enclosing class:
    AudioMethodsRecording

    public static class AudioMethodsRecording.RecordToFileThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    A thread for recording from a given TargetDataLine into an audio file belonging to one of a number of types. Can be interrupted by using the stopRecording method.

    WARNING:Note that the TargetDataLine is stopped and closed after recording has terminated. It will need to be re-started if it is to be used elsewhere.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        MAX_PRIORITY, MIN_PRIORITY, NORM_PRIORITY

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void run()
      Begins recording from the TargetDataLine to the file.
      void stopRecording()
      Causes the recording currently in progress to end and saves the recorded data to disk.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Begins recording from the TargetDataLine to the file. Continues until the stopRecording method is called.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • stopRecording

        public void stopRecording()
        Causes the recording currently in progress to end and saves the recorded data to disk.

        WARNING:Note that the TargetDataLine is stopped and closed after recording has terminated. It will need to be re-started if it is to be used elsewhere.
